result.execSummary:
The defendant Mack D. Wabbington was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery-Uttering, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If Probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental agencies for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

miscConds.notes: To be paid on a schedule set by probation agent.

Pepin County Restitution of $2469.25 + 10% restitution surcharge $246.93.
Read-in restitution from Dunn County Case No. 22CF30 of $4944.40 + 10% restitution surcharge $494.44 to Dunn Co. Clerk of Court.
Read-in restitution from Buffalo County Case No. 22CF68 of $2491.44 + 10% restitution surcharge $249.14 to Buffalo County Clerk of Court.

timeConds.notes: Huber release privileges granted if eligible under the Pepin County jail rules.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mack D. Wabbington

records.addlTxt: 11:29 AM Defendant Mack D. Wabbington appeared by video from the Pepin County Jail with Attorney Ryan Joseph Raymond appeared by video. Attorney Jon D. Seifert appeared by phone for State of Wisconsin.  Matter is resolved.  Mr. Wabbington will plead to amended count 1 uttering a forgery and move to amend count 1 to remove repeater allegation in the Information. There will be 2 cases from other jurisdictions to read in for restitution.  Buffalo Co. Case 22CF068 and Dunn Co. Case 22CF30 for restitution.  Paperwork was filed as the documentation regarding the restitution owed in those counties and in Pepin Co. as well.  There is a document filed for Extradition cost incurred in his case.  Recommend 5 yrs. probation.  Conditions: no contact with victims, all 3 are banks; pay restitution which totals around $10,000, Extradition costs and serve 120 days in the PCJ.   He has 58 days jail credit.  Court inquires how we get to 5 yrs. probation?  Recommendation State made.  Court states under 973.09(2)(b) the max. probation may not less than 1 year or max. term of confinement or 3 yrs. whichever is greater.  State modifies it's request for 3 years.  Attorney Raymond informs his client is prepared to plea.  Court advises of elements of charge without repeater allegation/max. penalties; right to appear in this fashion and constitutional rights he will be giving up.  Mr. Raymond satisifed factual basis for plea.  Court finds Mr. Wabbington KVI waives his constitutional rights and there is a factual basis for plea.  Defendant pleads no contest to count 1 without repeater allegation.  Court accepts his plea and finds him guilty without repeater allegation.  Atty Raymond sentencing arguments and believes appropriate disposition asks court adopt the agreement.  Defendant addresses the court.  As Mr. Raymond stated you successfully completed probation in the past.  Court will follow the plea agreement.  Restitution stipulated to.  Court withholds sentence and places defendant on 3 years probation; conditions:  no contact with the various banks involved, Waumandee Bank in Durand; Waumandee State Bank in Mondovi in Buffalo Co.; Dairy State Bank in Dunn Co. or their offices; restitution ordered in Pepin Co. $2469.25 to Waumandee State Bank in Durand and 10% VWC to the Pepin Co.; $2491.44 Waumandee State Bank in Mondovi Buffalo Co., $249.14 to Buffalo COC for 10% VWC; $4944.40 to Dairy Bank in Dunn Co. and $494.44 VWC to Dunn COC  Grand total $10,895.60.  Conditional jail 120 days with 58 days credit.  Report to the Pepin Co. probation here in Durand.  Submit DNA sample; Pay costs $518.00 to be set on a schedule set by Probation Agent.  Atty Raymond asks work release if he can obtain a job.  Huber release privileges granted if eligible under the Pepin Co. Jail rules.  Provide an updated address to the Pepin Co. Clerk of Court.
Buffalo County's Consent to Read In 2022CF68 for restitution.
Dunn County Consent to Read in 22CF30/Restitution Info.
NOH mailed to Mack Wabbington ret'd to sender, no such #...

1:03 PM Defendant Mack D. Wabbington appeared by video. Attorney Ryan Joseph Raymond appeared by video for Mack D. Wabbington.  Attorney Jon D. Seifert appeared by phone for State of Wisconsin.  Court advised defendant of charge in Information/max. penalties and rights.  Mr. Raymond waives reading and enters NGP, requesting a return date in 3 weeks, received discovery and an offer.
Status conference scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Status conference on August 16, 2022 at 11:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Mack D. Wabbington
Current: 1600 E 19th Ave Apt 312, Minneapolis, MN 55404 United States  (Effective: 06-28-2022)
Prior: Unknown, Minneapolis, MN 55404

09:13 AM Defendant Mack D. Wabbington appeared by zoom technology by video means without counsel from the Pepin County Jail. Prosecuting Atty Jon D. Seifert appeared for State of Wisconsin by phone means.  Court advises defendant of charge/max. penalties and rights.  State address bond.  Mr. Wabbington was charged in Pepin Co and arrest warrant been outstanding since March 2022.  He was arrested in Hennepin Co. and extradited.  He uttered about $2500 to bank.  He has a significant criminal history mostly from Texas and Louisiana; don't know if he has any connection to Wisconsin and certainly none to Pepin County; criminal history significant; there is significant restitution owed to the Bank and a cash bond appropriate of $2500.00.  There were previous arrest warrants referenced in the complaint out of Texas so there is a history of failure to appear and flight from arrest, lack of ties to Pepin Co. community and restitution due.  Court orders $2500.00 cash bond.  Contact the PD office.  Advised of right to PH within 10 days.  Attorney Ryan Raymond now joins the call.  Court recaps for Attorney Raymond.  He has a residence in MN although the warrant does not have an address.  His address is 1600 E 19th Ave Apt 312, Minneapolis, MN.  If he was summoned, he could have appeared.  He is indigent, ask for lower cash bond.  Court continues the order for $2500 cash bond.  Attorney Raymond waives the PH.  Court advises Mr. Wabbington of right to PH.  Defendant waives his right to PH.  Court finds Mr. Wabbington kvi waiving his statutory right to PH and bind him over.  State will file the Information as in the complaint.  Arraignment scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
